title: Matrix Solution of Linear Systems Quiz
description: Test your understanding of solving linear systems using matrix methods.

questions.question: What does AX = B represent in a system of equations?
questions.explanation: AX = B represents a system of linear equations in matrix form.

questions.question: When does a system AX = B have a unique solution?
options: When A has more rows than columns
questions.explanation: Unique solution exists when the coefficient matrix is invertible (det ≠ 0).

questions.question: What does det(A) = 0 indicate about the system AX = B?
questions.explanation: Singular systems may have no solution or infinite solutions.

questions.question: Which method gives the solution X = A⁻¹B?
questions.explanation: The matrix inverse method gives X = A⁻¹B.

questions.question: What must be true for Cramer's rule to work?
questions.explanation: Cramer's rule requires the coefficient matrix to be invertible.
